{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |sex=women |Year=2009-10 |Prev year=2008-09 |Next year=2010-11 |Team=Iowa Hawkeyes |Image= |Conference=Big Ten |division= |ShortConference=Big 10 |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=20-14 |ConfRecord=10-8 |HeadCoach=[[Lisa Bluder]] |AsstCoach1=Jan Jensen |AsstCoach2=Jenni Fitzgerald |AsstCoach3=Shannon Gage |StadiumArena= Carver-Hawkeye Arena |caBigity = |Champion=KCRG-TV9 Hawkeye Challenge champions |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }} {{2009â10 Big Ten women's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 Iowa Hawkeyes women's basketball team''' will represent the [[University of Iowa]] in the [[2009â10 NCAA Division I women's basketball season]]. The Hawkeyes are a member of the Big 10 and will attempt to win the NCAA championship.
==Offseason== *May 5: The University of Iowa women's basketball team will host Boston College as part of the third annual Big Ten/ACC Challenge. The game will be held at Carver-Hawkeye Arena on Dec. 2. This will be the first-ever meeting between Iowa and Boston College. Overall, Iowa is 9-4 against teams from the ACC.<ref>http://www.hawkeyesports.com/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/050509aab.html </ref> ==Exhibition== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style=" background:black;color:yellow;" | '''Date''' || '''Opponent''' || '''Location''' ||'''Time''' || '''Score''' || '''Record''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" |11/08/09 ||vs. Washburn (Exhibition) ||Iowa City, IA ||TBA||88-60|| |- align="center" bgcolor="" |} ==Regular season== The Hawkeyes will host the KCRG-TV9 Hawkeye Challenge from November 14â15. Illinois State, UCLA and Santa Clara are the other teams. From November 27â28, the Hawkeyes will compete in the Nugget Classic.The Hy-Vee Cy-Hawk Series will resume against Iowa State on December 10. ===Roster=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- ==Postseason== ===Big Ten tournament=== Iowa went into the 2009-2010 Big Ten Tournament with a 17-12 (9-8) record and was seeded 3rd. {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style=" background:black;color:yellow;" | '''Date''' || '''Round''' || '''Opponent (Seed)''' || '''Location''' ||'''Time''' || '''Result''' || '''Record''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" |03/04/10 ||First Round||Bye || Indianapolis, IN || || ||17-12 (9-8) |- align="center" bgcolor="" |03/05/10 ||Quarterfinals||vs. Penn State (6) || Indianapolis, IN ||1:00pm ||W 82-75 ||18-12 (10-8) |- align="center" bgcolor="" |03/06/10 ||Semifinals||at Michigan State (2) || Indianapolis, IN ||4:00pm ||W 59-54 ||19-12 (10-8) |- align="center" bgcolor="" |03/07/10 ||Finals||at Ohio State (1) || Indianapolis, IN ||3:30pm ||L 66-64 ||19-13 (10-8) |- align="center" bgcolor="" |}<ref>http://www.bigten.org/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/big10-10-wbb-tourney-central.html</ref>
===NCAA Basketball Tournament=== Iowa was invited to the 2009-2010 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament. They were seeded 8th in the Sacramento Division {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style=" background:black;color:yellow;" | '''Date''' || '''Round''' || '''Opponent (Seed)''' || '''Location''' ||'''Time''' || '''Result''' || '''Record''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" |03/20/10 ||First Round||vs. Rutgers (9) || Stanford, CA ||7:16pm ||W 70-63 ||20-13 |- align="center" bgcolor="" |03/22/10 ||Second Round||at Stanford (1) || Stanford, CA ||8:35pm ||L 96-67 ||20-14 |- align="center" bgcolor="" |}<ref>http://www.ncaa.com/brackets/basketball-women/d1/2010</ref>
